info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 10:14PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Eddy, Lea and northwestern Gaines Counties through 1100 PM CDT/1000 PM MDT/... At 1014 PM CDT/914 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lehman to 16 miles east of Artesia. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hobbs, Lovington, Tatum, Monument, Humble City, Maljamar, Crossroads, Caprock, McDonald, Lea County Zip Franklin Memorial Airport, Loco Hills, Gladiola, Tatum Airport, Knowles, Halfway, Lea County Regional Airport, Industrial Airpark and Higginbotham. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT/1000 PM MDT/ for southeastern New Mexico...and western Texas.
